subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (eu-west-1)

messages.content:
Subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (eu-west-1)

Automated detection from monitoring system:

The search-api service in the eu-west-1 region is experiencing critical backend issues, resulting in 500 Internal Server Errors. This is likely due to high load or a bug in the order processing logic. The affected scope includes endpoints related to order processing and search functionality. Customers are currently unable to successfully place orders or perform searches, which may lead to revenue loss and dissatisfaction. This issue is recurring and requires immediate attention.

Service: search-api
Region: eu-west-1
Severity: critical
Event Type: api

Metrics:
{
  "latency_ms": 729.57,
  "status_code": 500,
  "request_size_kb": 5.4
}

Workaround: There are no known workarounds at this time. It is recommended to investigate backend performance issues, check logs for errors, and consider scaling resources or optimizing the order processing logic.

This ticket was auto-generated by the AI monitoring system.

extracted_fields.requested_action: Immediate attention to resolve the critical backend issues.

current_triage.rationale: The ticket describes a critical issue with the search-api service resulting in 500 errors, affecting customer transactions and indicating a production outage.

current_routing.reasoning: Routed to engineering due to outage classification. SLA set based on enterprise tier and P0 priority. Escalated due to P0 critical priority.
